meanings.sent1: The picture was blurred, making it hard to see.
meanings.sent2: Her memory of the event was blurred by time.
meanings.sent3: The artist intentionally blurred the colors to create a dreamy effect.
meanings.sent4: The boundary between reality and fantasy was blurred in the movie.
meanings.sent5: The fog blurred the outline of the trees, creating a mystical scene.

meanings.definition: To make or become unclear or less distinct
meanings.sent1: The rain blurred the ink on the paper.
meanings.sent2: Tears blurred her vision as she cried.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick blurred the line between illusion and reality.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to blur as they lost themselves in conversation.
meanings.sent5: The speed of the car blurred the scenery outside the window.
